data.name: Osaka Castle
data.desc: It is one of the three biggest castles in Japan and boasts a huge scale. It is said that the present scale has also been greatly reduced compared to the original. Toyotomi Hideyoshi, who caused the Japanese invasion of the Imjin period, was built and famous for the war between his son Hidetada and Tokugawa Ieyasu. The present castle was rebuilt as concrete in the modern age. But it is well worth going around Osaka's outskirts.
data.time: 9:00 ~ 17:00 (Admission until 16:30) Opening hours are available depending on the season.
data.way: Tanimachi Line, Chuo Line Tanimachi Yonchome Station. Alternatively, get off at Osaka Jogakoen Station on the JR Osaka Kanjo Line.
data.fee: Exclusive free. Castle tower: Adult ¥ 600. Children free.

data.name: Osaka Museum of History
data.desc: A museum where you can observe the history of Osaka's 1,400 years from ancient times to the present. It is near Osaka Castle and it is good to take schedule together. Each floor has a different period exhibition hall, and on the top floor, the inside of Naniwa (Osaka old place) castle is reproduced in actual size. There is a detailed Korean language guide together.
data.time: Monday, Wednesday, Thursday: 9:30 to 17:00, Fri: 9:30 to 20:00 (Closed on Tuesdays and Closed on Tuesdays if Tuesday is closed)
data.way: Tanimachi Line, Chuo Line Tanimachi Yonchome Station. Alternatively, get off at Osaka Jogakoen Station on the JR Osaka Kanjo Line.

data.name: Osaka Castle Park
data.desc: A park surrounding Osaka Castle. In the middle of the city center, you can enjoy relaxing with a large tree.
data.way: Tanimachi Line, Chuo Line Tanimachi Yonchome Station. Alternatively, get off at Osaka Jogakoen Station on the JR Osaka Kanjo Line.

data.name: Osaka Business Park
data.desc: Newly developed suburbs developed around Osaka Castle. It is especially beautiful when the cherry blossoms are in full bloom, with offices of large Japanese corporations gathered. There is a statue of Detective Conan in front of Yomiuri TV.
data.way: Get off at Osaka Bijinespeaku Station on the Horizon Rumi Rokuchi Line.

data.name: Naniwa Palace Historical Park
data.desc: It is a palace built in 652. The fire was destroyed in 686, and it was discovered in 1953. Although it is a palace, it has not been remained.
data.way: Tanimachi Line, Chuo Line Tanimachi Yonchome Station.

data.name: Water bus
data.desc: Visitors can enjoy the atmosphere of Osaka along the Okawa River. There are 60-minute round-trip course and 20-minute one-way course departing from Osaka Jokko Pier. You can see Osaka, which is full of skyscrapers, on a flat-shaped cruise ship whose roof is covered with glass.
data.time: 10:00 to 17:00. [December to February] 10:00 to 16:00 (every hour interval)
data.way: Get off at Osaka Jokkoen Station on the JR Osaka Kanjo Line.
data.fee: [Osaka Castle, Nakanoshima Circle]: ¥ 1,700. Elementary school students and below ¥ 850. (From the end of March to mid-April ¥ 2,000, elementary school students and younger ¥ 1,000). [Osaka Castle, Yodoyabashi] ¥ 940. Since elementary school age ¥ 470. (From mid-March to mid-April ¥ 1,100. Elementary school students and younger ¥ 550.)

data.name: Mint Museum
data.desc: A museum made by renovating a thermal power plant completed in 1911. It is composed of three floors, and the corners showing the production process of 500 yen coins are impressive. The $ 50 commemorative coin of Bahamas, the largest coin in the world, is also on display.
data.time: 09:00 ~ 16:45. Closed on Saturdays, holidays, and year-end and New Year holidays.
data.way: Get off at Osaka Bisness Park Station on the Nagahoricrumiryokuchi Line.
